segment.source: Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 use XML settings location templates to define the settings that User Experience Virtualization captures and applies.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 use XML settings location templates to define the settings that User Experience Virtualization captures and applies.

segment.source: UE-V includes a set of standard settings location templates.
segment.target: UE-V includes a set of standard settings location templates.

segment.source: It also includes the UE-V Generator tool that enables you to create custom settings location templates.
segment.target: It also includes the UE-V Generator tool that enables you to create custom settings location templates.

segment.source: After you create and deploy settings location templates, you can manage those templates by using Windows PowerShell and the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).
segment.target: After you create and deploy settings location templates, you can manage those templates by using Windows PowerShell and the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).

segment.source: For a complete list of UE-V PowerShell cmdlets, see UE-V 2 Cmdlet Reference (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=393495).
segment.target: For a complete list of UE-V PowerShell cmdlets, see UE-V 2 Cmdlet Reference (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=393495).

segment.source: Manage UE-V 2 settings location templates by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Manage UE-V 2 settings location templates by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: The WMI and Windows PowerShell features of UE-V include the ability to enable, disable, register, update, and unregister settings location templates.
segment.target: The WMI and Windows PowerShell features of UE-V include the ability to enable, disable, register, update, and unregister settings location templates.

segment.source: By using these features, you can automate the process of registering, updating, or unregistering templates with the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: By using these features, you can automate the process of registering, updating, or unregistering templates with the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: You can also manually register templates by using WMI and Windows PowerShell commands.
segment.target: You can also manually register templates by using WMI and Windows PowerShell commands.

segment.source: By using these features in conjunction with an electronic software distribution solution, Group Policy, or another automated deployment method such as a script, you can further automate that process.
segment.target: By using these features in conjunction with an electronic software distribution solution, Group Policy, or another automated deployment method such as a script, you can further automate that process.

segment.source: You must have administrator permissions to update, register, or unregister a settings location template.
segment.target: You must have administrator permissions to update, register, or unregister a settings location template.

segment.source: Administrator permissions are not required to enable, disable, or list templates.
segment.target: Administrator permissions are not required to enable, disable, or list templates.

segment.source: ****To manage settings location templates by using Windows PowerShell****
segment.target: ****To manage settings location templates by using Windows PowerShell****

segment.source: Use an account with administrator rights to open a Windows PowerShell command prompt.
segment.target: Use an account with administrator rights to open a Windows PowerShell command prompt.

segment.source: Use the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets to register and manage the UE-V settings location templates.
segment.target: Use the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets to register and manage the UE-V settings location templates.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell command
segment.target: Windows PowerShell command

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer.
segment.target: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer.

segment.source: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer where the application name or template name contains string.
segment.target: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer where the application name or template name contains string.

segment.source: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer where the template ID contains string.
segment.target: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer where the template ID contains string.

segment.source: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer where the application or template name, or template ID contains string.
segment.target: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered on the computer where the application or template name, or template ID contains string.

segment.source: Gets the name of the program and version information, which depend on the template ID.
segment.target: Gets the name of the program and version information, which depend on the template ID.

segment.source: Gets the effective list of Windows apps.
segment.target: Gets the effective list of Windows apps.

segment.source: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the computer.
segment.target: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the computer.

segment.source: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the current user.
segment.target: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the current user.

segment.source: Registers one or more settings location template with UE-V by using relative paths and/or wildcard characters in file paths.
segment.target: Registers one or more settings location template with UE-V by using relative paths and/or wildcard characters in file paths.

segment.source: After a template is registered, UE-V synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers that have the template registered.
segment.target: After a template is registered, UE-V synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers that have the template registered.

segment.source: Registers one or more settings location template with UE-V by using literal paths, where no characters can be interpreted as wildcard characters.
segment.target: Registers one or more settings location template with UE-V by using literal paths, where no characters can be interpreted as wildcard characters.

segment.source: After a template is registered, UE-V synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers that have the template registered.
segment.target: After a template is registered, UE-V synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers that have the template registered.

segment.source: Unregisters a settings location template with UE-V.
segment.target: Unregisters a settings location template with UE-V.

segment.source: When a template is unregistered, UE-V no longer synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers.
segment.target: When a template is unregistered, UE-V no longer synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers.

segment.source: Unregisters all settings location templates with UE-V.
segment.target: Unregisters all settings location templates with UE-V.

segment.source: When a template is unregistered, UE-V no longer synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers.
segment.target: When a template is unregistered, UE-V no longer synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers.

segment.source: Updates one or more settings location templates with a more recent version of the template.
segment.target: Updates one or more settings location templates with a more recent version of the template.

segment.source: Use relative paths and/or wildcard characters in the file paths.
segment.target: Use relative paths and/or wildcard characters in the file paths.

segment.source: The new template should be a newer version than the existing template.
segment.target: The new template should be a newer version than the existing template.

segment.source: Updates one or more settings location templates with a more recent version of the template.
segment.target: Updates one or more settings location templates with a more recent version of the template.

segment.source: Use full paths to template files, where no characters can be interpreted as wildcard characters.
segment.target: Use full paths to template files, where no characters can be interpreted as wildcard characters.

segment.source: The new template should be a newer version than the existing template.
segment.target: The new template should be a newer version than the existing template.

segment.source: Removes one or more Windows apps from the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes one or more Windows apps from the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Removes Windows app from the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes Windows app from the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Removes all Windows apps from the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes all Windows apps from the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Removes one or more Windows apps from the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes one or more Windows apps from the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Removes all Windows apps from the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes all Windows apps from the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Disables a settings location template for the current user of the computer.
segment.target: Disables a settings location template for the current user of the computer.

segment.source: Disables one or more Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Disables one or more Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Disables one or more Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Disables one or more Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Enables a settings location template for the current user of the computer.
segment.target: Enables a settings location template for the current user of the computer.

segment.source: Enables one or more Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Enables one or more Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Enables one or more Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Enables one or more Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Determines whether one or more settings location templates comply with its XML schema.
segment.target: Determines whether one or more settings location templates comply with its XML schema.

segment.source: Can use relative paths and wildcard characters.
segment.target: Can use relative paths and wildcard characters.

segment.source: Determines whether one or more settings location templates comply with its XML schema.
segment.target: Determines whether one or more settings location templates comply with its XML schema.

segment.source: The path must be a full path to the template file, but does not include wildcard characters.
segment.target: The path must be a full path to the template file, but does not include wildcard characters.

segment.source: The UE-V Windows PowerShell features enable you to manage a group of settings templates that are deployed in your enterprise.
segment.target: The UE-V Windows PowerShell features enable you to manage a group of settings templates that are deployed in your enterprise.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to manage a group of templates by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to manage a group of templates by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: To manage a group of settings location templates by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To manage a group of settings location templates by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Modify or update the desired settings location templates.
segment.target: Modify or update the desired settings location templates.

segment.source: If you want to modify or update the settings location templates, deploy those settings location templates to a folder that is accessible to the local computer.
segment.target: If you want to modify or update the settings location templates, deploy those settings location templates to a folder that is accessible to the local computer.

segment.source: On the local computer, open a Windows PowerShell window with administrator rights.
segment.target: On the local computer, open a Windows PowerShell window with administrator rights.

segment.source: Unregister all the previously registered versions of the templates by typing the following command.
segment.target: Unregister all the previously registered versions of the templates by typing the following command.

segment.source: This command unregisters all active templates on the computer.
segment.target: This command unregisters all active templates on the computer.

segment.source: Register the updated templates by typing the following command.
segment.target: Register the updated templates by typing the following command.

segment.source: This command registers all of the settings location templates that are located in the specified template folder.
segment.target: This command registers all of the settings location templates that are located in the specified template folder.

segment.source: Windows app list
segment.target: Windows app list

segment.source: By listing a Windows app in the Windows app list, you specify whether that app is enabled or disabled for settings synchronization.
segment.target: By listing a Windows app in the Windows app list, you specify whether that app is enabled or disabled for settings synchronization.

segment.source: Apps are identified in the list by their Package Family name and whether settings synchronization should be enabled or disabled for that app.
segment.target: Apps are identified in the list by their Package Family name and whether settings synchronization should be enabled or disabled for that app.

segment.source: When you use these settings along with the Unlisted Default Sync Behavior setting, you can control whether Windows apps are synchronized.
segment.target: When you use these settings along with the Unlisted Default Sync Behavior setting, you can control whether Windows apps are synchronized.

segment.source: To display the Package Family Name of installed Windows apps, at a Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:
segment.target: To display the Package Family Name of installed Windows apps, at a Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:

segment.source: To display a list of Windows apps that can synchronize settings on a computer with their package family name, enabled status, and enabled source, at a Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:
segment.target: To display a list of Windows apps that can synchronize settings on a computer with their package family name, enabled status, and enabled source, at a Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:

segment.source: Definitions of Get-UevAppxPackage properties
segment.target: Definitions of Get-UevAppxPackage properties

segment.source: DisplayName
segment.target: DisplayName

segment.source: The name that is displayed to the user in the Company Settings Center application.
segment.target: The name that is displayed to the user in the Company Settings Center application.

segment.source: The property is derived from the property.
segment.target: The property is derived from the property.

segment.source: PackageFamilyName
segment.target: PackageFamilyName

segment.source: The name of the package that is installed for the current user.
segment.target: The name of the package that is installed for the current user.

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Defines whether the settings for the app are configured to synchronize.
segment.target: Defines whether the settings for the app are configured to synchronize.

segment.source: EnabledSource
segment.target: EnabledSource

segment.source: The location where the configuration that enables or disables the app is set.
segment.target: The location where the configuration that enables or disables the app is set.

segment.source: Possible values are: NotSet, LocalMachine, LocalUser, PolicyMachine, and PolicyUser.
segment.target: Possible values are: NotSet, LocalMachine, LocalUser, PolicyMachine, and PolicyUser.

segment.source: NotSet
segment.target: NotSet

segment.source: The policy is not configured to synchronize this app.
segment.target: The policy is not configured to synchronize this app.

segment.source: LocalMachine
segment.target: LocalMachine

segment.source: The enabled state is set in the local computer section of the registry.
segment.target: The enabled state is set in the local computer section of the registry.

segment.source: LocalUser
segment.target: LocalUser

segment.source: The enabled state is set in the current user section of the registry.
segment.target: The enabled state is set in the current user section of the registry.

segment.source: PolicyMachine
segment.target: PolicyMachine

segment.source: The enabled state is set in the policy section of the local computer section of the registry.
segment.target: The enabled state is set in the policy section of the local computer section of the registry.

segment.source: To get the user-configured list of Windows apps, at the Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:
segment.target: To get the user-configured list of Windows apps, at the Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:

segment.source: To get the computer-configured list of Windows apps, at the Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:
segment.target: To get the computer-configured list of Windows apps, at the Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:

segment.source: For either parameter, CurrentComputerUser or Computer, the cmdlet returns a list of the Windows apps that are configured at the user or at the computer level.
segment.target: For either parameter, CurrentComputerUser or Computer, the cmdlet returns a list of the Windows apps that are configured at the user or at the computer level.

segment.target: DisplayName

segment.target: The name that is displayed to the user in the Company Settings Center application.

segment.source: The property is derived from the property.
segment.target: The property is derived from the property.

segment.source: PackageFamilyName
segment.target: PackageFamilyName

segment.source: The name of the package that is installed for the current user.
segment.target: The name of the package that is installed for the current user.

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Defines whether the settings for the app are configured to synchronize for the specified switch, that is, user or computer.
segment.target: Defines whether the settings for the app are configured to synchronize for the specified switch, that is, user or computer.

segment.source: Installed
segment.target: Installed

segment.source: True if the app, that is, the PackageFamilyName is installed for the current user.
segment.target: True if the app, that is, the PackageFamilyName is installed for the current user.

segment.source: Manage UE-V 2 settings location templates by using WMI
segment.target: Manage UE-V 2 settings location templates by using WMI

segment.source: User Experience Virtualization provides the following set of WMI commands.
segment.target: User Experience Virtualization provides the following set of WMI commands.

segment.source: Administrators can use these interfaces to manage settings location templates from Windows PowerShell and automate template administrative tasks.
segment.target: Administrators can use these interfaces to manage settings location templates from Windows PowerShell and automate template administrative tasks.

segment.source: To manage settings location templates by using WMI
segment.target: To manage settings location templates by using WMI

segment.source: Use an account with administrator rights to open a Windows PowerShell window.
segment.target: Use an account with administrator rights to open a Windows PowerShell window.

segment.source: Use the following WMI commands to register and manage the UE-V settings location templates.
segment.target: Use the following WMI commands to register and manage the UE-V settings location templates.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered for the computer.
segment.target: Lists all the settings location templates that are registered for the computer.

segment.source: Gets the name of the program and version information, which depends on the template name.
segment.target: Gets the name of the program and version information, which depends on the template name.

segment.source: Gets the effective list of Windows apps.
segment.target: Gets the effective list of Windows apps.

segment.source: Get-WmiObject -Namespace root\Microsoft\UEV MachineConfiguredWindows8App
segment.target: Get-WmiObject -Namespace root\Microsoft\UEV MachineConfiguredWindows8App

segment.source: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the computer.
segment.target: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the computer.

segment.source: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the current user.
segment.target: Gets the list of Windows apps that are configured for the current user.

segment.source: Registers a settings location template with UE-V.
segment.target: Registers a settings location template with UE-V.

segment.source: Unregisters a settings location template with UE-V.
segment.target: Unregisters a settings location template with UE-V.

segment.source: As soon as a template is unregistered, UE-V no longer synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers.
segment.target: As soon as a template is unregistered, UE-V no longer synchronizes the settings that are defined in the template between computers.

segment.source: Updates a settings location template with UE-V.
segment.target: Updates a settings location template with UE-V.

segment.source: The new template should be a newer version than the existing one.
segment.target: The new template should be a newer version than the existing one.

segment.source: Removes one or more Windows apps from the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes one or more Windows apps from the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Removes one or more Windows apps from the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Removes one or more Windows apps from the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Disables one or more settings location templates with UE-V.
segment.target: Disables one or more settings location templates with UE-V.

segment.source: Disables one or more Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Disables one or more Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Disables one or more Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Disables one or more Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Enables a settings location template with UE-V.
segment.target: Enables a settings location template with UE-V.

segment.source: Enables Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.
segment.target: Enables Windows apps in the computer Windows app list.

segment.source: Enables Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.
segment.target: Enables Windows apps in the current user Windows app list.

segment.source: Determines whether a given settings location template complies with its XML schema.
segment.target: Determines whether a given settings location template complies with its XML schema.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Where a list of Package Family Names is called by the WMI command, the list must be in quotes and separated by a pipe symbol, for example, .
segment.target: Where a list of Package Family Names is called by the WMI command, the list must be in quotes and separated by a pipe symbol, for example, .

segment.source: Deploying the UE-V Agent using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Deploying the UE-V Agent using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: How to deploy the UE-V Agent by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: How to deploy the UE-V Agent by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Stage the UE-V Agent installation package in an accessible network share.
segment.target: Stage the UE-V Agent installation package in an accessible network share.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Use AgentSetup.exe to deploy both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Use AgentSetup.exe to deploy both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: The Windows Installer packages, AgentSetupx86.msi and AgentSetupx64.msi, are available for each architecture.
segment.target: The Windows Installer packages, AgentSetupx86.msi and AgentSetupx64.msi, are available for each architecture.

segment.source: To uninstall the UE-V Agent at a later time by using the installation file, you must use the same file type.
segment.target: To uninstall the UE-V Agent at a later time by using the installation file, you must use the same file type.

segment.source: Use one of the following Windows PowerShell commands to install the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Use one of the following Windows PowerShell commands to install the UE-V Agent.
